intro: Ruellia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Ruellia glandulosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
